Legal_Issue: Reasonableness of the Board's decision on credibility and country conditions
Evidence_Assessment: Minor discrepancies, lack of corroboration, delay in claiming status
Decision_Outcome: Refugee protection claim denied by the Board
Burden_of_Proof: On the applicant to establish a well-founded fear of persecution
Credibility_Factor: Discrepancies deemed trivial, inadequate analysis by the Board
Legal_Rule: Credibility assessments must be justified, transparent, and intelligible; country conditions must be considered
Procedural_Issue: Failure to provide transparent and intelligible reasoning
Grounds_for_Claim: Threats from the Taliban in Afghanistan
Outcome_on_Merits: Claim dismissed due to credibility concerns
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Board failed to adequately analyze evidence and ignored country condition reports
Applicant_Challenge: Unreasonable credibility assessment and disregard of country conditions
Court_Result: Federal Court overturned the Board's decision
Legal_Rule_Source: Federal Court jurisprudence on credibility and refugee protection
Remedy_Sought: Judicial review of the Board's decision
Resolution_Mechanism: Judicial review by the Federal Court
Legal_Provision: Section 96-97 of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Legal_Provision_Cited: IRPA sections on refugee protection and credibility
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Persecution based on political opinion or membership in a particular social group
Applicable_Process: Refugee protection hearing before the IRB
Outcome_of_Review: Board's decision set aside, matter remitted
Governing_Rule: Duty to provide reasoned, transparent, and justifiable decisions
